page.title: 12A Headmaster Talks.
page.content: Severn Vale Secondary Modern School was opened in Quedgeley in 1961. In 1985 it had 490 children, of whom about 70 live in Quedgeley. Others travel from as far away as Arlingham. There are 27 teachers. Mr. Lutkins, headmaster since 1973, finds the children in his charge very friendly. The most important lesson that the children should learn, he believes, is to care for other people. One of the most pleasing things to have happened at the school recently is the way pupils have looked after a badly physically handicapped boy. Mr. Lutkins recalls going into assembly one day, and finding all the children facing the wrong way. Realising that it was April 1st, he successfully managed to persuade many children to look up at the ceiling where, he claimed, hung an elephant.
